text: broccoli soup is one of my favorite
pureed vegetable soups but sometimes
they get a little dull and this is a
really great fresh recipe it's bright
green super vibrant easy to make so
let's start in a large pot add about a
tablespoon of olive oil and 1 leek that
I've thinly sliced the leek adds a
really nice sort of subtle sweetness
that brings out the flavor and the
broccoli it's been a few minutes and
leeks are looking nice and tender and
bright green so to that add 4 cups of
either chicken broth water vegetable
stock however you want to do it I'm
using chicken broth here and we'll bring
this mixture up to a boil my broth has
come up to a boil and now we will add
the broccoli and it's really important
to add the broccoli only once the liquid
has come up to a boil because we're
basically blanching / steaming it we
want to cook it as quickly as possible
so that it retains its beautiful green
color and nutrients so that the rest of
this and this was one head of broccoli
which is about a pound that I just
chopped up into about half-inch size
pieces so give this a quick stir cover
it and we're going to set a timer for
two minutes
Oh gorgeous nice and bright green I'm
just going to make sure that it's tender
perfect nice and tender so turn the heat
off we'll give it a stir and to this add
six ounces of baby spinach this is not
only going to make the color nice and
bright and green and vibrant this is
adding tremendous amount of nutrients
iron calcium vitamin C supersuit that's
what we'll call this - this add two
tablespoons tahini this is going to add
a really nice nutty rich flavor also add
some protein
and 1/3 cup grated Parmesan now the
reason I turn the heat off is because we
just want to basically wilt the spinach
we don't want to overcook it so we'll
just stir all this down season it with a
little bit more salt some black pepper
the spinach is all the way wilted so
we're going to blend this in batches
beautiful beautiful so we'll let this
hang off to the side here you can always
adjust the consistency by adding a
little bit more water or stock very easy
now for the finishing touch it's just
simply avocado sliced on whole grain
toasted bread I usually drizzle a little
bit of olive oil on the bread just for
fun so let's assemble the toast just
arrange the sliced avocados on your
toasted bread I'm using a seated
whole-grain bread here squeeze it with a
little bit of lemon juice and season
with salt and pepper of course
so now we'll top it with some fresh
radish sprouts these add a really nice
crunchy texture looks good I think for
eating purposes probably slice this in
half just to make it a little bit easier
and now for our soup you can see it's a
beautiful green color here so vibrant
nice and rich and creamy we'll add our
toasts and lunch is served I think I'm
going to add just a little bit of black
pepper to the soup
why not it's my favorite let's try our
soup mmm so tasty essence of broccoli
now for our avvocato toast chaser mmm
super delicious combination winning pair
delicious creamy broccoli soup without
the cream
you
